code: @Manual{,   title = {adj: Lightweight Adjacency Lists},   author = {Christopher T. Kenny and Cory McCartan},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {http://christophertkenny.com/adj/}, }

title: Lightweight Adjacency Lists
text: adj provides lightweight adjacency list class R, built vctrs package. allows pretty printing along several validation checks.

title: Lightweight Adjacency Lists
text: can install development version adj GitHub :

title: Lightweight Adjacency Lists
text: adj comes loaded example data seven bridges Königsberg. can build adjacency graph using unique identifiers area. Alternatively, can create adjacency list list integers. , set duplicates = "remove" remove duplicate edges.
code: library(adj) data("konigsberg")  konigsberg #>   area     bridge_to #> 1    A B, B, C, C, D #> 2    B       A, A, D #> 3    C       A, A, D #> 4    D       A, B, C adj(konigsberg$bridge_to, ids = konigsberg$area, duplicates = "allow") #> <adj[4]> #> [1] {2, 2, 3, …} {1, 1, 4}    {1, 1, 4}    {1, 2, 3} adj_int <- lapply(konigsberg$bridge_to, function(x) match(x, LETTERS))  adj(adj_int, duplicates = "remove") #> <adj[4]> #> [1] {2, 3, 4} {1, 4}    {1, 4}    {1, 2, 3}

title: adj: Lightweight Adjacency Lists — adj-package
text: Provides S3 class represent graph adjacency lists using 'vctrs'. Allows creation, subsetting, combining, pretty printing lists. Adjacency lists can easily converted zero-indexed lists, allows easy passing objects low-level languages processing.

title: adj: Lightweight Adjacency Lists — adj-package
text: Maintainer: Christopher T. Kenny ctkenny@proton.(ORCID) Authors: Cory McCartan mccartan@psu.edu (ORCID)

title: Internal vctrs methods — adj-vctrs
text: Internal vctrs methods

title: Create an adjacency list — adj
text: Create adjacency list list vectors adjacent node identifiers.

title: Create an adjacency list — adj
code: adj(   ...,   ids = NULL,   duplicates = c("warn", "error", "allow", "remove"),   self_loops = c("warn", "error", "allow", "remove") )  as_adj(x)  is_adj(x)  adj_to_list(x, ids = NULL)

title: Create an adjacency list — adj
text: ... Vectors single list vectors. Vectors comprised either (1-indexed) indices adjacent nodes, unique identifiers, must match provided ids. NULL can used place length-zero vector nodes without neighbors. ids vector unique node identifiers. provided vector ... matched identifiers. NULL, identifiers taken 1-indexed integers. duplicates Controls handling duplicate neighbors. value "warn" warns user; "error" throws error; "allow" allows duplicates, "remove" removes duplicates silently sets corresponding attribute "error". self_loops Controls handling self-loops (nodes adjacent ). value "warn" warns user; "error" throws error; "allow" allows self-loops, "remove" removes self-loops silently sets corresponding attribute "error". x adj list

title: Create an adjacency list — adj
text: adj list

title: Create an adjacency list — adj
text: Equality adj lists evaluated elementwise. Two sets neighbors considered equal contain neighbors, regardless order.

title: Create an adjacency list — adj
text: adj package focused graph operations. length() function return number nodes. compute number edges adjacency list , use sum(lengths()), divide 2 undirected graphs.

title: Create an adjacency list — adj
code: a1 = adj(list(c(2, 3), c(1, 3), c(1, 2))) a2 = adj(list(c(3, 2), c(3, 1), c(2, 1))) a1 == a2 #> [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE  adj(2:3, NULL, 4:5, integer(0), 1) #> <adj[5]> #> [1] {2, 3} {}     {4, 5} {}     {1}    adj(1, 2, 3, self_loops = "remove") #> <adj[3]> #> [1] {} {} {}  adj(konigsberg$bridge_to, ids = konigsberg$area, duplicates = "allow") #> <adj[4]> #> [1] {2, 2, 3, …} {1, 1, 4}    {1, 1, 4}    {1, 2, 3}    adj(konigsberg$bridge_to, ids = konigsberg$area, duplicates = "remove") #> <adj[4]> #> [1] {2, 3, 4} {1, 4}    {1, 4}    {1, 2, 3}

title: Factor adjacency list — adj_factor
text: Computes factor graph given adjacency list provided grouping vector. Nodes groups merged single nodes factor graph. resulting multi-edges self-loops handled according specified parameters.

title: Factor adjacency list — adj_factor
code: adj_factor(   x,   groups,   duplicates = c("remove", "allow", "error", "warn"),   self_loops = c("remove", "allow", "error", "warn") )  adj_factor_int(   x,   groups,   n_groups,   duplicates = c("remove", "allow", "error", "warn"),   self_loops = c("remove", "allow", "error", "warn") )

title: Factor adjacency list — adj_factor
text: x adj list groups vector specifying group membership node x. adj_factor() process vector vctrs::vec_group_id(); adj_factor_int() expects (1-indexed) integer vector. duplicates Controls handling duplicate neighbors. value "warn" warns user; "error" throws error; "allow" allows duplicates, "remove" removes duplicates silently sets corresponding attribute "error". self_loops Controls handling self-loops (nodes adjacent ). value "warn" warns user; "error" throws error; "allow" allows self-loops, "remove" removes self-loops silently sets corresponding attribute "error". n_groups Number unique groups.

title: Factor adjacency list — adj_factor
text: new adj list.

title: Factor adjacency list — adj_factor
code: a <- adj(konigsberg$bridge_to, ids = konigsberg$area, duplicates = "allow") # merge two islands (A and D) adj_factor(a, c("AD", "B", "C", "AD")) #> <adj[3]> #> [1] {2, 3} {1}    {1}    adj_factor_int(a, c(1L, 2L, 3L, 1L), n_group = 3L, self_loops = "allow") #> <adj[3]> #> [1] {2, 3, 1} {1}       {1}

what: Convert adjacency lists to and from adjacency matrices — adj_from_matrix
title: Convert adjacency lists to and from adjacency matrices — adj_from_matrix
text: Adjacency lists can converted adjacency matrices vice versa without loss.

title: Convert adjacency lists to and from adjacency matrices — adj_from_matrix
code: adj_from_matrix(   x,   duplicates = c("warn", "error", "allow", "remove"),   self_loops = c("warn", "error", "allow", "remove") )  # S3 method for class 'adj' as.matrix(x, ...)

title: Convert adjacency lists to and from adjacency matrices — adj_from_matrix
text: x adjacency list matrix duplicates Controls handling duplicate neighbors. value "warn" warns user; "error" throws error; "allow" allows duplicates, "remove" removes duplicates silently sets corresponding attribute "error". self_loops Controls handling self-loops (nodes adjacent ). value "warn" warns user; "error" throws error; "allow" allows self-loops, "remove" removes self-loops silently sets corresponding attribute "error". ... Ignored.

title: Convert adjacency lists to and from adjacency matrices — adj_from_matrix
text: adj_from_matrix() returns adj list; .matrix() returns matrix.

title: Convert adjacency lists to and from adjacency matrices — adj_from_matrix
code: adj_from_matrix(1 - diag(3)) #> <adj[3]> #> [1] {2, 3} {1, 3} {1, 2}  a = adj(konigsberg$bridge_to, ids = konigsberg$area, duplicates = "allow") mat = as.matrix(a) all(a == adj_from_matrix(mat, duplicates = "allow")) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE

text: x adjacency list.

title: Convert adjacency list to use zero-based indices — adj_zero_index
code: a <- adj(konigsberg$bridge_to, ids = konigsberg$area, duplicates = "allow") adj_zero_index(a) #> [[1]] #> [1] 1 1 2 2 3 #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] 0 0 3 #>  #> [[3]] #> [1] 0 0 3 #>  #> [[4]] #> [1] 0 1 2 #>

title: Format and print methods for adjacency lists — format.adj
code: a = adj(konigsberg$bridge_to, ids = konigsberg$area, duplicates = "allow") format(a) #> [1] "{2, 2, 3, …}" "{1, 1, 4}"    "{1, 1, 4}"    "{1, 2, 3}"    print(a, n = 5) #> <adj[4]> #> [1] {2, 2, 3, 3, 4} {1, 1, 4}       {1, 1, 4}       {1, 2, 3}

what: The Seven Bridges of Königsberg — konigsberg
title: The Seven Bridges of Königsberg — konigsberg
text: dataset encoding adjacency structure seven bridges Königsberg, Prussia, described Leonhard Euler 1736.

title: The Seven Bridges of Königsberg — konigsberg
The Seven Bridges of Königsberg — konigsberg
text: data frame 4 rows 2 columns: area four land areas, -D, described Euler. Area '' corresponds central island Kneiphof. bridge_to list column, entry character vector listing areas directly connected bridges area row.

title: The Seven Bridges of Königsberg — konigsberg
text: Euler, Leonhard (1741). "Solutio problematis ad geometriam situs pertinentis". Commentarii Academiae Scientiarum Petropolitanae: 128–140.
